page.title: 16ARTS/ENTERTAINMENT IN LEWES
page.content: With no commercial entertainment in Lewes, all is organised, and mostly performed, by{local people,}drawing on an enormous amount of local talent. {All Saints' Centre}is typical: a disused church converted by volunteers and MSC money to an arts centre: full- scale opera to a Toy Library for todd- lers.{Lewes Little Theatre}stages, in its own theatre, high standard monthly amateur performances.{Lewes Operatic {Society}entertains the town with at least two light operas a year. Several {pantos}are performed in community centres around Christmas. Although there is no town orchestra or choir, there are{musical {groups}performing classical, folk and jazz in pubs, halls or homes. Young people go to ballet or drama classes. {Sussex Rural School}offers a variety of instrumental teaching.
